bibl.title: Letter from [Caroline Latimer] to Edwin Denby, December [?], 1907

div1.p: [Latimer] notes that Kissinger already receives a small annual pension.

div1.head: Letter from [Caroline Latimer] to Edwin Denby, December [?], 1907
div1.opener:
1418 Eutaw Place
December Y, 1907
Hon. Edwin Denby,
Dear Sir:
div1.p:
Dr. Kelly finds on communicating with Kissin-
ger in reagrd to papers for securing a pension that he has already
a small one of twelve dollars a year. It seems that Mrs Kissinger
forgot to ley Dr. Kelly know this when it was granted last february
or else her latter about it was lsot. If the pensikn could be in-
creased to fifty dollars a month it would be everything to Kissinger
and his wife, and Dr. Kelly hopes this may be possible. He wishes
me to ask you whether if the pecion is already grated it is necessary
to forward the informatio, certificates etc. which would be necessary
in the first instance. Mr. Mason the ex-senator from Illinois is
warmly interested in the matter.
